item.description:
Come join AMC Trip Leader Dan Bolton for a gorgeous hike along the newly developed Quabbin to Monadnock Trail.


Quabbin to Monadnock Trail Hike, Q&M. 10 miles. 600 elevation gain. Average terrain. Moderate pace. 1.5 to 2 mph. This is a new trail system in the North Quabbin region, Southern NH area. The goal of the trail is to connect Quabbin to Mt Monadnock, as well as everything in between. The section we are hiking is nearly completed. We will hike the section between Doanes Falls in Royaston, and the Bearsden forest in Athol. This hike will include some of the trails of Bearsden. Scenic views of forests, wetlands, Millers River, Thousand Acre Brook Falls, Newton Reservoir. Spot cars. Bring water, lunch, snacks. Wear weather appropriate clothing and boots. No cotton. wear some color orange, hunting season. Limited to 14. Heavy rain, snow, or other severe weather cancels.
Meeting at Athol High School at 9am to spot cars from there.

Date(s): October 13, 2012 (Sat)
Location: Royalston, Athol, Massachusetts, Central, MA
Difficulty: Moderately strenuous
Offered By: Worcester (Mass.)
Leader: Dan Bolton
(978) 895-3979 (best time to call: Anytime)
danbolton2000@yahoo.com

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Quabbin to Monadnock Trail (10 mile) Hike
